By clicking Authorize, you are allowing this application and to use your information in accordance with their respective terms of service and privacy policies. You can change this and other account permissions at any time from the Profile menu.
Enter your email address and we will help you reset your password.
Check your inbox for an email to confirm this request and choose a new password.
Badges are your achievements that show when and how you achieved them. They are made to be shared!
Save your badges in your Backpack
Organize, display and manage your badges.
Share your badges with the desired group of people.
Bid as Issuer Badges for skills.
Individual people or organizations can award badges. Register as an issuer!
What do the frames and colors mean?
The badges are divided into four categories:
A badge from the 'Professional Competence' category reflects a specific achievement in a technical area level. The level achieved can be classified into one of six consecutive levels become:

Badges from the 'Metacompetence' category represent higher-level skills from the areas of strategic tegical and problem-solving work. Here the service is also structured into six consecutive of the building stages:
A badge from the 'Participation' category is independent of services provided and can awarded or obtained through attendance at listed events.
Membership in a club, institution or similar characterizes people for this to receive a badge from the 'Member' category. The service provided is not here significant.
Previous changes will be overwritten when copying!
Please use English terms to search for the icons.
The embed code goes here and changes dynamically as the checks and radios are pressed above.
Once you have created a badge, you can give it to as many recipients as you want.
previous awards. You can use the Next/Back buttons below to view additional awards, or search for assignments using the exact email address/recipient ID.
Badge images can be either PNGs or SVGs or the icons selected via the icon search. About that A frame is automatically placed on the selected image/icon, depending on the category.
What do the frames and colors mean?
Criteria (At least one of the fields is mandatory.)

The criteria field describes exactly what needs to be done to receive the badge. Some issuers choose a URL on your website as an information page that explains what the badge is about and how you receive it.
Either text or a URL is mandatory.
In the duration field you describe the time scope of the service that is necessary to receive the badge.
As a category you choose between participation/success, membership, professional competence or a meta-competence.

Competencies are represented in 6 levels: A1 beginner, A1 explorer, B1 insider, B2 Expert, C1 leader and C2 pioneer. In the badge image you can recognize the level by the number of them marked edges clockwise.

Open badges can optionally be linked to educational standards. This link information can be important for people who see which badges you have received or for people who consider receiving a specific badge.
Tags are an optional way to describe a badge. Tags help you find badges on certain topics.
Describe the duration for which this badge is generally valid. This information can also be found at the award can be changed. Badges are marked as expired once their validity expires.
Find out more about Open Badges
Edit the information about this achievement.
Rows can be imported. Rows are duplicates and will be ignored. Click click GIVE BADGE to award the badge.
Notify the recipient with an email
Rows are imported. The following contain errors. Please fix the errors or select REMOVE.
You can import a list of recipients who should receive the badge. The file must look like this:
Include email address and proof URLCSV oder TXT Format.
Use these Example template to create a CSV or TXT file
Here's a preview of the first one from lines of your file. Choose the appropriate heading matches the respective column of your CSV file.
The CSV file contains lines longer than its heading. Please fix this error and try again.
Award the badge to a user or click here to send the badge to several users at the same time to award.
You can assign the bage via an email address or URL.
Note: The recipient's name is saved as plain text in the badge.
Please enter a valid email address.
Please enter a valid phone number.
The narrative is a general description of the success related to the badge.
Evidence is proof that the recipient meets the relevant criteria to receive a badge. This can be in the form of a narrative that describes success and/or as a URL of a website.
The badge can have an expiration date. Here you can set, edit or delete it if the badge should not expire.
Please enter a date in the form YYYY-mm-dd.
Create an institution to award badges.
I have read and agree to the Privacy Policy to them. Please read the privacy policy and agree to it if you wish to continue.

The issuer does not have any badges yet
You haven't created an institution yet
With institutions you can create badges and give them to users.
New Staff Members must create and verify a Badgr account prior to being added to an issuer.
Your badges are in the zip file from Mozilla.
That’s not the file from Mozilla. Please try again.
We’re uploading your badge(s). This might take a minute.
Congrats! badges of uploaded will be added to your Backpack
We also found badges awarded to the following email addresses. You'll need to verify these email addresses before you can import the badges.
Only valid badges can be added to your backpack. The good news is that your badges are saved on your device and available for you at any time.
You can earn a badge in less than 5 min. Promise.
The following apps and sites have access to yours Account
This app has access to your Account.
Badgr connects with Canvas to automatically award badges to students as they complete their work.
Make sure your Badgr account has the email address confirmed that you log into Canvas with.
Log into Canvas with your administrator credentials. Go to the desired Canvas account or sub-account, choose Settings in the left-hand menu, and select the Apps tab

Select Badgr from the list (if connected with the EduAppCenter) or add a new custom integration Copy the values for your LTI Shared Secret and Consumer key from Badgr into the dialog If you are not using the EduAppCenter, choose the By URL method and copy the Consumer key and Shared Secret into the dialog, along with the Config URL
Submit the form and refresh the page
Observe that a new Badges tab will appear on your left-side course navigation in all courses on the account
Don’t have your current password? Click here to reset by email.
Authorized: This application has been granted permission to sign you in using your Badgr account. Visit Website
Know who you are on Badgr
Click one of the provider buttons below to allow you to log in to in the future using that service rather than your email and password.

MINT-O-Badges is based on preliminary considerations for an open badge system that can be used in schools and schools can be used in an extracurricular context as well as an initial technical feasibility study for one “Open Badges Platform” at the Institute for Geoinformatics at the University of Münster as part of the BMBF project senseBox Pro was carried out. As part of the hackathon “#WirFürSchule” 2020, a... The project idea was further developed by an interdisciplinary team and an initial prototype was implemented. This one This version of MINT-O-Badges is based on the open source Open Badges standard "badgr" from concentricsky and was created with the kind support of the Deutsche Telekom Foundation by re:edu GmbH & Co. KG implemented in collaboration with Junge Tüftler*innen gGmbH. A development of integrations too Platforms of the senseBox Pro project (Blockly learning environment and openSenseMap) are used as part of the BMBF funding developed.

With the funding measure 'Open Photonics Pro', the Federal Ministry of Education and... Research (BMBF) aims to develop new forms of cooperation between science and business to enable the maker and founder scene. The aim is to open up additional areas Innovation paths and potential. At the same time, innovation cycles should be significantly shortened and the networking of these groups can be sustainably improved.
1. Can badges only be distributed and used in the school context?

Badgr can be used across institutions: both in a formal school context also outside. It therefore offers the potential to be a bridge between formal, non-formal, and to build informal educational institutions and to make them more interconnected in the sense of networking connect. This is important because learning in the sense of lifelong and networked learning occurs everywhere takes place. Important skills are also acquired in informal areas, which are needed in the spirit of the future Skills can be of great importance.
2. Which level (A1 to C2) of the badges describes which level?

The awarding of badges is based on the level of independence and the level of complexity Skill. We are guided by the 6 competency levels of Digcomp Edu. A1: Beginner - Initial knowledge has been acquired but cannot yet be applied become. A2: Explorer - Basic knowledge and skills are available with which Further knowledge can be acquired in a self-directed manner. This can be used in standard situations but it is not enough to be able to solve unexpected problems independently. B1: Insiders - Acquired knowledge and skills can be applied to unknown people Situations are transferred. B2: Expert - The knowledge is used to understand connections and possible alternatives recognize. In addition, there is the competence to independently acquire and develop additional knowledge Sharing knowledge (digitally). C1: Leader - The developed knowledge and skills are based on Experiences used and applied innovatively. C2: Pioneer - Through the acquired skills you can develop your own skills and New definitions are carried out and existing procedures are critically examined.
3. Why are badges with a six-point scale used here and not traditional school grades?

Badgr is based on the portfolio approach in their pedagogical and didactic concept This makes the documentation of the learner's achievements much more appropriate. The connection of the Portfolio approach with the concept of Open Badges makes it possible to create a documentation system where teachers and learners get the most comprehensive possible experience using authentic evidence and work Gain a picture of the learner's acquired skills, progress and development motivating and encouraging for the individual. Traditionally existing grading systems in School contexts, on the other hand, have a strong classifying effect and are generalizing in many aspects Individuals' learning achievements are not sufficiently adequate and often have a demotivating effect.
4. How are the badges transferred from the issuer to the learners? What data must/am I allowed to use? Raise organization from learners?

Data protection has the highest priority, which is why data is saved as much as possible. The issuer requires from the learner only receives an email address. The badges are saved to this email address.
for documentation & feedback of the learning process
With the help of Mozilla's Open Badges, we are developing an open and scalable one Documentation system to prove acquired competencies and skills in school and extracurricular environment.
The badges are contextualized and the learning achievements are documented using an e-portfolio.

Our feedback system motivates participants to enjoy learning and helps them to do so realistic self-assessment of their own progress. At the same time it offers learning support Orientation about the level of performance and thus forms an important basis for further development didactic-pedagogical planning of the learning process.
Our approach is based on 6 principles:
#offen Other institutions can expand the system according to their educational offerings develop.
#transparent & flexible The learner has insight into his portfolio and can decide for himself who he should give which provides information.
#standardized By bringing together various educational actors, a standardization tool is created, that provides orientation.
#motivating “Portfolio & Badges are a form of performance representation; not the rating. They promote the Appreciation for the acquired skills and increasing the learner's self-responsibility.
#digital & decentralized We rely on established technical standards with which proof of competence is created digitally can be managed decentrally.
#individually “Portfolio & Badges can document individual learning paths and thus promote this self-determined, lifelong learning.
